title: 道德經
source: Chinese Text Project (ctext.org) - James Legge translation

passages.en: (The placid and contented nature) The highest excellence is like (that of) water.

passages.zh: 水善利萬物而不爭，處衆人之所惡，故幾於道。
passages.en: The excellence of water appears in its benefiting all things, and in its occupying, without striving (to the contrary), the low place which all men dislike. Hence (its way) is near to (that of) the Dao.

passages.zh: 居善地，心善淵，與善仁，言善信，正善治，事善能，動善時。
passages.en: The excellence of a residence is in (the suitability of) the place; that of the mind is in abysmal stillness; that of associations is in their being with the virtuous; that of words is in their trustworthiness; that of government is in its securing good order; that of (the conduct of) affairs is in its ability; and that of (the initiation of) any movement is in its timeliness.
And when (one with the highest excellence) does not wrangle (about his low position), no one finds fault with him.
